intro: Melanoseris aitchisoniana, commonly known as the Aitchison's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Pakistan and India. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in dry, hot climates. It produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
